columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the net present value of a project that is eligible for 100 percent bonus depreciation.
To solve this, we must first define what bonus depreciation is the value that can be deducted from the taxable income based on the depreciation of the equipment and the tax rate.

To get the present value cash flow, we will first get the operating cash flow. The operating cash flow can be solved using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{Operating cash flow}&=\text{Savings} \times(1-\text{Tax rate})\\ &+\text{Tax rate} \times \text{Depreciation} \end{aligned}$$

The depreciation will be solved using the Modified Accelerated Cost Recovery System where a specific factor will be multiplied to the initial cost to get the depreciation.

The factors are:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{Year 1}&=0.20\\ 
\text{Year 2}&=0.32\\ 
\text{Year 3}&=0.192\\ 
\text{Year 4}&=0.1152\\
\text{Year 5}&=0.1152
\end{aligned}$$
​

The depreciation for **Year 1** is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$425,000 \times 0.20\\[15 pt]
&=\$85,000
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation for **Year 2** is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$425,000 \times 0.32\\[15 pt]
&=\$136,000
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation for **Year 3** is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$425,000 \times 0.192\\[15 pt]
&=\$81,600
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation for **Year 4** is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$425,000 \times 0.1152\\[15 pt]
&=\$48,960
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation for **Year 5** is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$425,000 \times 0.1152\\[15 pt]
&=\$48,960
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the depreciation to the formula for operating cash flow, we will get:

OCF for **Year 1**:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$275,000\times(1-0.22)\\ 
&+0.22 \times \$85,000\\[15 pt] 
&=\$233,200
\end{aligned}$$

OCF for **Year 2**:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$275,000\times(1-0.22)\\ 
&+0.22 \times \$136,000\\[15 pt] 
&=\$244,420
\end{aligned}$$

OCF for **Year 3**:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$275,000\times(1-0.22)\\ 
&+0.22 \times \$81,600\\[15 pt] 
&=\$232,452
\end{aligned}$$

OCF for **Year 4**:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$275,000\times(1-0.22)\\ 
&+0.22 \times \$48,960\\[15 pt] 
&=\$225,271.20
\end{aligned}$$

OCF for **Year 5**:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$275,000\times(1-0.22)\\ 
&+0.22 \times \$48,960\\[15 pt] 
&=\$225,271.20
\end{aligned}$$

For the initial net working capital, we have $\$25,000$ which is already state din the problem. For Year 1 up to Year 4, we will simply add the fixed cost as well as the variable cost.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net working capital for Year 1  to 4}&=\$47,000 +(0.35 \times \$275,000)\\[15 pt]
&=\$143,250
\end{aligned}$$

For the net working capital for Year 5, we will add the initial net working capital and the net working capital for Years 1 to 4.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net working capital for Year 5}&=\$25,000+(4 \times \$143,250)\\[15 pt]
&=\$598,000
\end{aligned}$$

The net working capital for Year 5 is $\$598,000$

Another thing to solve for is the after-tax salvage value. Simply multiply the value at the end of the project by 1 minus the tax rate:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{After-tax salvage value}&=\$425,000\times (1-0.22)\\[15 pt]
 &=\$331,500
\end{aligned}$$
 

The after-tax salvage value of this machine is $\$331,500$

Simplifying the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value cash flow}&=\$1,045,183.94
\end{aligned}$$

The present value cash flow for this is $\$1,045,183.94$

Now that we have the necessary values, we can solve for the net present value using the formula in Step 2. Additionally, since the project qualifies for 100 percent bonus depreciation, we will add the initial investment times the tax rate to the total value to get the NPV.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{NPV}&=\$1,045,183.94-\$425,000-\$25,000\\
&+(0.22 \times \$425,000)\\[15 pt]
&=\$688,683.94
\end{aligned}$$ 

The net present value of this project is $\$688,683.94$
